article.title: Galaxy @ Plant & Animal Genome XXVII (PAG 2019)
article.tease: Galaxy is for Plants and Animals too...

article.content:
Galaxy will be at Plant and Animal Genome XXVII (PAG 20189, in San Diego, California, United States, January 12-16. This includes a Galaxy Workshop as well as other talks and posters featuring Galaxy. Here's what we know about:

Date Time Topic Session Links Contact
Saturday, January 12 10:30-10:46 ELIXIR Resources for Interoperability Interoperability and Federation Across Bioinformatic Platforms and Resources, California Room Slides Frederik Coppens
10:46-11:02 Cyberinfrastructure for Landscape Genomics: Connecting Biological Databases, Metadata, and Intelligent Analytics Interoperability and Federation Across Bioinformatic Platforms and Resources, California Room Slides Jill L. Wegrzyn
11:34-11:54 Efficient Integration of Marker-Assisted and Genomic Selection in a Modern Rice-Breeding Program Connecting Crop Phenotype and Genotype Data, Golden Ballroom Juan D. Arbelaez
11:54-12:04 Connecting Genotyping Data, Sample IDs, Breeding Data and Analysis Tools to Facilitate Breeding Decisions Connecting Crop Phenotype and Genotype Data, Golden Ballroom Slides Elizabeth Jones
Sunday, January 13 5:20-5:40 Execution of Scientific Workflows for Tripal-Based Community Databases Tripal Database Network and Initiatives, California Room Slides Shawna Spoor
5:40-6:00 Beyond Search and Display - Analyze Tripal Data with CartograTree Tripal Database Network and Initiatives, California Room Slides Sean Buehler
Monday, January 14 10:00-11:30 P42: G-OnRamp: Create Genome Browsers for Collaborative Eukaryotic Genome Annotations Poster Session - Even Numbers Poster Luke Sargent
10:00-11:30 P48: Execution of Scientific Workflows for Tripal-Based Community Databases Poster Session - Even Numbers Stephen P. Ficklin
1:10-1:30 The Genomic Open-Source Breeding Informatics Initiative: Developing a Global Community of Knowledge Surrounding the Use of Markers in Genomic Selection Integrated Breeding Platform: Tools, Databases and Applications for Plant Breeding, Golden Ballroom Elizabeth Jones
2:10-2:30 TreeGenes and CartograTree: Tools for Forest Tree Genomics Digital Tools and Resources Session 2, California Room Slides Emily Grau
3:00-4:30 P21: OrthoQuery: A Tripal Database Module to Assess and Visualize Gene Family Evolution Poster Session - Odd Numbers Poster Sumaira Zaman
3:00-4:30 P43: Galaxy Tools for Comparative Gene Family Analysis in Plant Genomics Poster Session - Odd Numbers Poster Eric Wafula
3:00-4:30 P527: TreeGenes and CartograTree: Tools for Forest Tree Genomics Poster Session - Odd Numbers Poster Emily Grau
4:51-5:14 TreeGenes: Past, Present, and Future Development Data Resource Sustainability and Funding, Esquire - Meeting House Slides Jill L. Wegrzyn
Tuesday, January 15 11:15-11:30 Integrated Genomic Selection Galaxy Analysis Pipeline and Workflows Digital Tools and Resources Session 3, California Room Slides Star Yanxin Gao
4:00-4:25 Introduction to Galaxy and the Galaxy Ecosystem Galaxy: An Open Platform for Data Analysis and Integration, California Room Slides Frederik Coppens
4:25-4:45 A Phenomenal Workflow to Study the Metabolites Variation in Bryophytes across Seasons Galaxy: An Open Platform for Data Analysis and Integration, California Room Slides Steffen Neumann
4:45-5:05 Galaxy Tools for Comparative Gene Family Analysis in Plant Genomics Galaxy: An Open Platform for Data Analysis and Integration, California Room Slides Eric Wafula
5:05-5:25 Galaxy Metabolomics from the Ground up Galaxy: An Open Platform for Data Analysis and Integration, California Room Slides Arthur Eschenlauer
5:25-5:45 Multi-Omics with Galaxy for Diverse Biological Applications Galaxy: An Open Platform for Data Analysis and Integration, California Room Slides Tim Griffin, Pratik Jagtap
5:45-6:05 Eukaryotic Genome Annotation with G-OnRamp Galaxy: An Open Platform for Data Analysis and Integration, California Room Slides Luke Sargent
Wednesday, January 16 11:45-12:00 OrthoQuery: A Tripal Database Module to Assess and Visualize Gene Family Evolution Digital Tools and Resources Session 4, California Room Slides Sumaira Zaman

Galaxy @ PAG 2019 Flier

Presentations that prominently feature Galaxy are shown in bold and are highlighted in the Galaxy @ PAG 2019 Flier.

Get yourself a copy now.
